Regeneration.name: Regeneration
Regeneration.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] regains [[lookup @healing.formula activity=5cGvjZJIJVicjJ3d]] Hit Points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 Hit Point.

heal.condition: starts its turn with at least 1 Hit Point

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmClaw0000000000]] or [[/item .mmNightmareRay00]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item .mmSpellcasting00]].

Nightmare Ray.name: Nightmare Ray
Nightmare Ray.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Frightened.name: Frightened
Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the start of the attacking creature’s next turn

Shape-Shift.name: Shape-Shift
Shape-Shift.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] shape-shifts into a Small or Medium Humanoid or a Large Giant, or it returns to its true form. Other than its size, its game statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCharmPerso]{Charm Person} (level 2 version), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDarkness00]{Darkness}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGaseousFor]{Gaseous Form}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSleep00000]{Sleep}

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility} on itself, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability.

7zCgLqwWT0prZxhy.name: Invisibility
7zCgLqwWT0prZxhy.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Charm Person.name: Charm Person
Charm Person.description:
One Humanoid you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. It does so with Advantage if you or your allies are fighting it. On a failed save, the target has the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition until the spell ends or until you or your allies damage it. The Charmed creature is Friendly to you. When the spell ends, the target knows it was Charmed by you.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Charmed.name: Charmed
Charmed.description: the target has the &Reference[charmed apply=false] condition until the spell ends or until you or your allies damage it. The Charmed creature is Friendly to you. When the spell ends, the target knows it was Charmed by you.

Darkness.name: Darkness
Darkness.description:
你指定施法距离内一点，并在法术持续时间内使魔法性&Reference[darkness]{黑暗}斥以该点为中心半径 15 尺的球状区域。黑暗视觉也无法看穿这这种黑暗，非魔法的光照也无法将其照亮。

或者，你可以将此法术施展于一个未被着装或携带的物件上，使黑暗充斥以该物件为中心的 15 尺光环区域。将该物件用不透明的东西遮掩（比如用碗或头盔盖住）时，会将黑暗隔绝。

如果法术区域与任何二环或更低环阶法术创造的明亮光照或微光光照区域重叠，则这些造光的法术将被解除。

materials.value: bat fur and a piece of coal

Gaseous Form.name: Gaseous Form
Gaseous Form.description:
A willing creature you touch shape-shifts, along with everything it's wearing and carrying, into a misty cloud for the duration. The spell ends on the target if it drops to 0 Hit Points or if it takes a Magic action to end the spell on itself.

While in this form, the target's only method of movement is a Fly Speed of 10 feet, and it can hover. The target can enter and occupy the space of another creature. The target has Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage; it has Immunity to the &Reference[prone apply=false] condition; and it has Advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. The target can pass through narrow openings, but it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces.

The target can't talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can't be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. Finally, the target can't attack or cast spells.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Gaseous Form.name: Gaseous Form
Gaseous Form.description:
The target’s only method of movement is a Fly Speed of 10 feet, and it can hover. The target can enter and occupy the space of another creature. The target has Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage; it has Immunity to the &Reference[prone apply=false] condition; and it has Advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws. The target can pass through narrow openings, but it treats liquids as though they were solid surfaces.

The target can’t talk or manipulate objects, and any objects it was carrying or holding can’t be dropped, used, or otherwise interacted with. Finally, the target can’t attack or cast spells.

Sleep.name: Sleep
Sleep.description:
以施法距离内一点为源点，5 尺半径球状区域内每个你选择的生物都必须成功通过一次感知豁免否则直到其下个回合结束陷入&Reference[incapacitated apply=false]状态。在其下个回合结束时，它必须重复此豁免。如果目标第二次豁免失败，目标在持续时间内陷入&Reference[unconscious]如果目标受到伤害，或其 5 尺内有人用一个动作将它摇醒，目标身上的法术结束。

不会睡眠的生物，比如精灵或免疫力竭状态的生物自动成功通过对抗此法术的豁免。

materials.value: a pinch of sand or rose petals

Sleeping.name: Sleeping
Sleeping.description: The target has the &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn, at which point it must repeat the save. If the target fails the second save, the target has the &Reference[unconscious] condition for the duration. The spell ends on a target if it takes damage or someone within 5 feet of it takes an action to shake it out of the spell’s effect.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and two [[/item Tentacle]] attacks.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition. Whenever the Poisoned target finishes a Long Rest, it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.formula activity=tKShuY4vDM7tn9aC]].

Failure: The target's Hit Point maximum decreases by [[/damage 1d10 average]] and doesn't return to normal until the Poisoned condition ends on the target.

Success: The Poisoned condition ends.

save.condition: Whenever the Poisoned target finishes a Long Rest

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition. Whenever the Poisoned target finishes a Long Rest, it must make a Constitution Saving Throw or have its Hit Point maximum reduced by [[/damage 1d10 average]] until the Poisoned condition ends.

Tentacle.name: Tentacle
Tentacle.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]) from one of two tentacles.

Grappled.description:

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Stunned apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Stunned.name: Stunned
Stunned.description: The target has the &Reference[Stunned apply=false] condition until the start of the attacking creature's next turn.

Beguiling Song.name: Beguiling Song
Beguiling Song.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=rbe2FvPTepUsO4GL]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=rbe2FvPTepUsO4GL]]-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within [[lookup @range.value activity=rbe2FvPTepUsO4GL]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Charmed.name: Charmed
Charmed.description: The target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the end of the attacking creature's next turn.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPrestidigi]{Prestidigitation}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplTashasHide]{Tasha’s Hideous Laughter} (level 3 version)

Tasha's Hideous Laughter.name: Tasha's Hideous Laughter
Tasha's Hideous Laughter.description:
One creature of your choice that you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it has the &Reference[prone apply=false] and &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] conditions for the duration. During that time, it laughs uncontrollably if it’s capable of laughter, and it can’t end the Prone condition on itself.

At the end of each of its turns and each time it takes damage, it makes another [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] saving throw. The target has Advantage on the save if the save is triggered by damage. On a successful save, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level about 1.

Uncontrollable Laughter.name: Uncontrollable Laughter
Uncontrollable Laughter.description:
has the &Reference[prone apply=false] and &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] conditions for the duration. During that time, it laughs uncontrollably if it’s capable of laughter, and it can’t end the Prone condition on itself.

At the end of each of its turns and each time it takes damage, it makes another [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] saving throw. The target has Advantage on the save if the save is triggered by damage. On a successful save, the spell ends.

Prestidigitation.name: Prestidigitation
Prestidigitation.description:
You create a magical effect within range. Choose the effect from the options below. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time.

Sensory Effect. You create an instantaneous, harmless sensory effect, such as a shower of sparks, a puff of wind, faint musical notes, or an odd odor.

Fire Play. You instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a small campfire.

Clean or Soil. You instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot.

Minor Sensation. You chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour.

Magic Mark. You make a color, a small mark, or a symbol appear on an object or a surface for 1 hour.

Minor Creation. You create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand. It lasts until the end of your next turn. A trinket can deal no damage and has no monetary worth.

Flyby.name: Flyby
Flyby.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn’t provoke an &Reference[OpportunityAttacks]{Opportunity Attack} when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

Talons.name: Talons
Talons.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the attack reduces a Humanoid target to 0 Hit Points, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] kills the target by removing its heart.

Gore.name: Gore
Gore.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended average]]. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] [[lookup @activation.condition activity=iBenqFiBu40bUxkH]] straight toward the target immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) Piercing damage.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item .mmGore0000000000]] attack and one [[/item .mmTalons00000000]] attack.

Phaerimm Agent.name: Phaerimm Agent
Phaerimm Agent.description:
Alien, Magic-Obsessed Manipulators

Phaerimm are malevolent alien beings that seek to dominate other sentient species. A phaerimm’s conical body ripples through the air, trailing behind a large, flat mouth ringed by four delicate arms. A phaerimm’s body tapers to a venomous stinger they prefer to use only when magical means fail them.

Ancient phaerimm devastated the once-powerful empire of Netheril. The phaerimm were imprisoned beneath the great desert of Anauroch, where they plot a return to their former dominion. Roll or choose a result from the Phaerimm Plots table as inspiration for what a phaerimm agent might be doing when encountered.

@embed[Compendium.dnd-adventures-faerun.tables.RollTable.aifPhaerimmPlots rollable resultLabel="The Phaerimm Is …"]

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The phaerimm casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15):

At Will: [[/item .pEhiVsn7tpKoz6xR]]{Detect Magic}, [[/item .ozub6AoxcwAzhZBw]]{Detect Thoughts}, [[/item .PexcN93VXsgT57aA]]{Mage Hand}

1/Day Each: [[/item .E6fYjUUZ0mXwABZC]]{Clairvoyance}, [[/item .wVxjEuMkpLWo409n]]{Major Image}, [[/item .ij2fAAlPK5yFwx5B]]{Synaptic Static}

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The phaerimm makes three attacks, using [[/item Dread Stinger]] or [[/item Mindwarp Ray]] in any combination.

Mindwarp Ray.name: Mindwarp Ray
Mindwarp Ray.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]., and the target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the start of the phaerimm’s next turn.

Teleport.name: Teleport
Teleport.description: The phaerimm teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

Protective Magic.name: Protective Magic
Protective Magic.description: The phaerimm casts [[/item .0EN7pI6wKid62eU4]]{Counterspell} or [[/item .zSg8AXbTvTo6HcpO]]{Shield} in response to the spell’s trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Detect Magic.name: Detect Magic
Detect Magic.description:
在法术持续时间内，你感受到距你 30 尺内的魔法效应。若你感知到了此类效应，则你可以用一个魔法动作以看到任何带有此魔法的可见生物或物件周围环绕着微弱的灵光，且若此魔法属于被法术创造的效应，则你可分辨出其所属的魔法学派。

此法术会被 1 尺厚的岩石、泥土或木头，1 寸厚的金属，或薄薄一层铅阻隔。

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don't read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target's mind right now. If the target doesn't know any languages and isn't telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target's mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target's reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target's mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Mage Hand.name: Mage Hand
Mage Hand.description:
一只漂浮的幽灵手出现在施法距离内你指定的一点。幽灵手持续存在至法术终止。如果幽灵手距你的距离超过 30 尺，或者当你再次施展了该法术时，则现存的幽灵手消失不见。

你可以在施展该法术时使用幽灵手实施一个行为：你可以操控一个物件，或者打开一扇未上锁的门或容器，或者将一件物品放入或取出一个打开的容器，或者将小瓶中的内容物倾倒出来。

在后续的回合中，以一个魔法动作，你可以控制幽灵手再次实施一个行为。作为那个动作的一部分，你可以令幽灵手移动至多 30 尺。

该幽灵手不能攻击，也不能激活魔法物品或承载超过 10 磅重的物质。

Clairvoyance.name: Clairvoyance
Clairvoyance.description:
You create an Invisible sensor within range in a location familiar to you (a place you have visited or seen before) or in an obvious location that is unfamiliar to you (such as behind a door, around a corner, or in a grove of trees). The intangible, invulnerable sensor remains in place for the duration.

When you cast the spell, choose seeing or hearing. You can use the chosen sense through the sensor as if you were in its space. As a Bonus Action, you can switch between seeing and hearing.

A creature that sees the sensor (such as a creature benefiting from See Invisibility or &Reference[truesight]) sees a luminous orb about the size of your fist.

materials.value: a focus worth 100+ GP, either a jeweled horn for hearing or a glass eye for seeing

Major Image.name: Major Image
Major Image.description:
你创造一个影像，其形象来自一个大小不超过边长 20 尺立方体的物件或生物，或是其他的可视现象。影像出现在施法距离内你能看见的一处位置并在法术持续时间内维持存在。它看起来完全是真实的，并且还具有相应的声音、气味和温度。但它无法造成伤害或让人陷入任何状态。

在该幻象施法距离内时，你可以用一个魔法动作将影像移动到施法距离内的另一个位置。影像改变位置时，你可以改变影像的外表来使它移动得更自然。例如，如果你创造了一个生物的影像并移动它，则你可以改变影像，使它看起来就像是在走路。或者你也可以让影像在不同的时间发出不同的声音，甚至可以让它参与一场对话。

由于影像可以被穿过，任何与该影像进行的物理互动都会暴露其幻象的本质。一个生物用研究动作调查影像时，它可以进行一次对抗你的法术豁免 DC 的 [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spelldc]] 检定，以判定是否看穿幻象。辨出幻象的生物可以看破该影像，而影像的其他感官效应在该生物看来会变得微弱而模糊。

升环施法： 使用高于三环的法术位时，法术时间持续至被解除且无需专注。

Counterspell.name: Counterspell
Counterspell.description: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. The creature makes a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the spell dissipates with no effect, and the action, Bonus Action, or Reaction used to cast it is wasted. If that spell was cast with a spell slot, the slot isn't expended.

activation.condition: 当你看见范围内一名生物施展一道法术时执行

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: An imperceptible barrier of magical force protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile}.

activation.condition: when you are hit by an attack roll or targeted by the Magic Missile spell

Imperceptible Barrier.name: Imperceptible Barrier
Imperceptible Barrier.description: Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from Magic Missile.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Synaptic Static.name: Synaptic Static
Synaptic Static.description:
You cause psychic energy to erupt at a point within range. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point makes an Intelligence saving throw, taking 8d6 Psychic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

On a failed save, a target also has muddled thoughts for 1 minute. During that time, it subtracts [[/r 1d6]] from all its attack rolls and ability checks, as well as any Constitution saving throws to maintain Concentration. The target makes an [[/save ability=int dc=@attributes.spell.dc format=long]] at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Muddled Thoughts.name: Muddled Thoughts
Muddled Thoughts.description: The target subtracts 1d6 from all its attack rolls and ability checks, as well as any Constitution saving throws to maintain Concentration. The target makes an [[/save ability=int format=long]] at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Phaerimm Hatchling.name: Phaerimm Hatchling
Phaerimm Hatchling.description:
Alien, Magic-Obsessed Manipulators

Phaerimm are malevolent alien beings that seek to dominate other sentient species. A phaerimm’s conical body ripples through the air, trailing behind a large, flat mouth ringed by four delicate arms. A phaerimm’s body tapers to a venomous stinger they prefer to use only when magical means fail them.

Ancient phaerimm devastated the once-powerful empire of Netheril. The phaerimm were imprisoned beneath the great desert of Anauroch, where they plot a return to their former dominion. Roll or choose a result from the Phaerimm Plots table as inspiration for what a phaerimm agent might be doing when encountered.

Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Ethereal Sight.name: Ethereal Sight
Ethereal Sight.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Web Walker.name: Web Walker
Web Walker.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] ignores movement restrictions caused by webs, and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] knows the location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmBite0000000000]] attacks.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If this damage reduces the target to 0 Hit Points, the target becomes Stable, and it has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 hour. While Poisoned, the target also has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition.

Poisoned & Paralyzed.name: Poisoned & Paralyzed
Poisoned & Paralyzed.description: f this damage reduces the target to 0 Hit Points, the target becomes Stable, and it has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 hour. While Poisoned, the target also has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition.

Ethereal Jaunt.name: Ethereal Jaunt
Ethereal Jaunt.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] teleports from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane or vice versa.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Drop.name: Drop
Drop.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] falls.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=yaKOcl4gDETLWHTE]], [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=yaKOcl4gDETLWHTE]] directly underneath the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Failure or Success: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] reduces any damage it takes from the fall by 20.

Pirate.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepDagger0000]{Daggers (6)}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbarmLeatherArm]{Leather Armor}

Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .MC6uJTSfGDW6jSdI]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item .mmEnthrallingPan]].

Enthralling Panache.name: Enthralling Panache
Enthralling Panache.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=66IPjaLIJqqwvmrL]], [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=66IPjaLIJqqwvmrL]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=66IPjaLIJqqwvmrL]] feet.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Charmed.description: The target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the start of the attacking creature’s next turn.

Pirate Captain.description:
Gear: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepPistol0000]{Pistol}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepRapier0000]{Rapier}

Rapier.name: Rapier
Rapier.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of this turn.

Advantage: Next Attack.name: Advantage: Next Attack
Advantage: Next Attack.description: On a hit with its rapier on the current attack, the attacking creature has Advantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of this turn.

Pistol.name: Pistol
Pistol.description: Ranged Attack Roll: +7, range 30/90 ft. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) Piercing damage.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks, using [[/item .SHobhYTtELnIVQHw]] or [[/item .y2po5bpBbyIFIuVO]] in any combination.

Captain's Charm.name: Captain's Charm
Captain's Charm.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=3o27u4Ww7SmCgc8k]], one creature the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=3o27u4Ww7SmCgc8k]] feet.

Failure: The target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Charmed.name: Charmed
Charmed.description: The target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the start of the user's next turn.

Riposte.name: Riposte
Riposte.description:
Trigger: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon.

Response: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] adds 3 to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss. On a miss, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one Rapier attack against the triggering creature if within range.

Foundry Note

This feature also provides an Active Effect (AE) that will modify this creature's Armor Class when you utilize the reaction. You can enable the AE in the effects tab of the character sheet.

+3 AC.name: +3 AC
+3 AC.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] adds 3 to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss.

Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] or &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition ([[lookup @name lowercase]]’s choice) until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]’s next turn.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDancingLig]{Dancing Lights}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDruidcraft]{Druidcraft}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility} (self only)

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplFly0000000]{Fly}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMajorImage]{Major Image}

Burst of Wonder.name: Burst of Wonder
Burst of Wonder.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplEntangle00]{Entangle}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPolymorph0]{Polymorph}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplTashasHide]{Tasha's Hideous Laughter}, requiring no Material components and using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Polymorph.name: Polymorph
Polymorph.description:
You attempt to transform a creature that you can see within range into a Beast. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or shape-shift into a Beast form for the duration. That form can be any Beast you choose that has a Challenge Rating equal to or less than the target’s (or the target’s level if it doesn’t have a Challenge Rating). The target’s game statistics are replaced by the stat block of the chosen Beast, but the target retains its alignment, personality, creature type, Hit Points, and Hit Point Dice. See appendix B for a sample of Beast stat blocks.

The target gains a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to the Hit Points of the Beast form. The spell ends early on the target if it has no Temporary Hit Points left.

The target is limited in the actions it can perform by the anatomy of its new form, and it can’t speak or cast spells.

The target’s gear melds into the new form. The creature can’t use or otherwise benefit from any of that equipment.

Entangle.name: Entangle
Entangle.description:
Grasping plants sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into &Reference[difficultterrain]. They disappear when the spell ends.

Each creature (other than you) in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have the &Reference[restrained apply=false] condition until the spell ends. A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Restrained.name: Restrained
Restrained.description: A Restrained creature can take an action to make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath]] check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself from the grasping plants and is no longer Restrained by them.

Tasha's Hideous Laughter.name: Tasha's Hideous Laughter
Tasha's Hideous Laughter.description:
One creature of your choice that you can see within range makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it has the &Reference[prone apply=false] and &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] conditions for the duration. During that time, it laughs uncontrollably if it’s capable of laughter, and it can’t end the Prone condition on itself.

At the end of each of its turns and each time it takes damage, it makes another [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] saving throw. The target has Advantage on the save if the save is triggered by damage. On a successful save, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level about 1.

Uncontrollable Laughter.name: Uncontrollable Laughter
Uncontrollable Laughter.description:
has the &Reference[prone apply=false] and &Reference[incapacitated apply=false] conditions for the duration. During that time, it laughs uncontrollably if it’s capable of laughter, and it can’t end the Prone condition on itself.

At the end of each of its turns and each time it takes damage, it makes another [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] saving throw. The target has Advantage on the save if the save is triggered by damage. On a successful save, the spell ends.

Dancing Lights.name: Dancing Lights
Dancing Lights.description:
You create up to four torch-size lights within range, making them appear as torches, lanterns, or glowing orbs that hover for the duration. Alternatively, you combine the four lights into one glowing Medium form that is vaguely humanlike. Whichever form you choose, each light sheds Dim Light in a 10-foot radius.

As a Bonus Action, you can move the lights up to 60 feet to a space within range. A light must be within 20 feet of another light created by this spell, and a light vanishes if it exceeds the spell’s range.

Druidcraft.name: Druidcraft
Druidcraft.description:
Whispering to the spirits of nature, you create one of the following effects within range.

Weather Sensor. You create a Tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts what the weather will be at your location for the next 24 hours. The effect might manifest as a golden orb for clear skies, a cloud for rain, falling snowflakes for snow, and so on. This effect persists for 1 round.

Bloom. You instantly make a flower blossom, a seed pod open, or a leaf bud bloom.

Sensory Effect. You create a harmless sensory effect, such as falling leaves, spectral dancing fairies, a gentle breeze, the sound of an animal, or the faint odor of skunk. The effect must fit in a 5-foot Cube.

Fire Play. You light or snuff out a candle, a torch, or a campfire.

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Detect Thoughts.name: Detect Thoughts
Detect Thoughts.description:
You activate one of the effects below. Until the spell ends, you can activate either effect as a Magic action on your later turns.

Sense Thoughts. You sense the presence of thoughts within 30 feet of yourself that belong to creatures that know languages or are telepathic. You don’t read the thoughts, but you know that a thinking creature is present.

The spell is blocked by 1 foot of stone, dirt, or wood; 1 inch of metal; or a thin sheet of lead.

Read Thoughts. Target one creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself or one creature within 30 feet of yourself that you detected with the Sense Thoughts option. You learn what is most on the target’s mind right now. If the target doesn’t know any languages and isn’t telepathic, you learn nothing.

As a Magic action on your next turn, you can try to probe deeper into the target’s mind. If you probe deeper, the target makes a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you discern the target’s reasoning, emotions, and something that looms large in its mind (such as a worry, love, or hate). On a successful save, the spell ends. Either way, the target knows that you are probing into its mind, and until you shift your attention away from the target’s mind, the target can take an action on its turn to make an [[/check ability=int skill=arc dc=@attributes.spell.dc]] check against your spell save DC, ending the spell on a success.

Fly.name: Fly
Fly.description:
You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target gains a Fly Speed of 60 feet and can hover. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft unless it can stop the fall.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 3.

Major Image.name: Major Image
Major Image.description:
你创造一个影像，其形象来自一个大小不超过边长 20 尺立方体的物件或生物，或是其他的可视现象。影像出现在施法距离内你能看见的一处位置并在法术持续时间内维持存在。它看起来完全是真实的，并且还具有相应的声音、气味和温度。但它无法造成伤害或让人陷入任何状态。

在该幻象施法距离内时，你可以用一个魔法动作将影像移动到施法距离内的另一个位置。影像改变位置时，你可以改变影像的外表来使它移动得更自然。例如，如果你创造了一个生物的影像并移动它，则你可以改变影像，使它看起来就像是在走路。或者你也可以让影像在不同的时间发出不同的声音，甚至可以让它参与一场对话。

由于影像可以被穿过，任何与该影像进行的物理互动都会暴露其幻象的本质。一个生物用研究动作调查影像时，它可以进行一次对抗你的法术豁免 DC 的 [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spelldc]] 检定，以判定是否看穿幻象。辨出幻象的生物可以看破该影像，而影像的其他感官效应在该生物看来会变得微弱而模糊。

升环施法： 使用高于三环的法术位时，法术时间持续至被解除且无需专注。

Hold Breath.name: Hold Breath
Hold Breath.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can hold its breath for 1 hour.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two [[/item .mmRend0000000000]] attacks.

Polar Serpent.name: Polar Serpent
Polar Serpent.description:
Ephemeral, Heat-Draining Elemental

Polar serpents are large, white snakes of mist and cold that lurk in snowy places of the world. They pursue warm-blooded prey through snowstorms and fog, wrapping around their victims to drain away their heat.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The serpent makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and uses [[/item Constrict]].

Constrict.name: Constrict
Constrict.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=RCCfdd3DQDbj4csk]], one Medium or smaller creature the snake can see within 10 feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage. The target has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]), and it has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Grappled & Restrained.name: Grappled & Restrained
Grappled & Restrained.description: The target has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 14), and it has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Misty Slithering.name: Misty Slithering
Misty Slithering.description: The serpent can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch without expending extra movement to do so.

Incorporeal Movement.name: Incorporeal Movement
Incorporeal Movement.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can move through other creatures and objects as if they were &Reference[Difficult Terrain]. It takes [[/damage 1d10 average type=force]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes one [[/item .mmObjectSlam0000]] attack and uses [[/item .mmTelekineticThr]].

Object Slam.name: Object Slam
Object Slam.description: Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach [[lookup @item.range.reach]] ft. or range [[lookup @item.range.value]]/[[lookup @item.range.long]] ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Telekinetic Thrust.name: Telekinetic Thrust
Telekinetic Thrust.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=qHeMp7n2VPHtGbDS]], [[lookup @target.affects.labels.statblock activity=qHeMp7n2VPHtGbDS]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=qHeMp7n2VPHtGbDS]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target is pushed up to [[lookup @range.value activity=qHeMp7n2VPHtGbDS]] [[lookup @range.units activity=qHeMp7n2VPHtGbDS]]. straight away from the [[lookup @name lowercase]].

Vanish.name: Vanish
Vanish.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] and its light have the &Reference[Invisible apply=false] condition or ends that condition on itself.

Invisible.name: Invisible
Invisible.description: The attacking creature and its light have the &Reference[Invisible apply=false] condition until their Concentration ends on this effect, which ends early immediately after the wisp makes an attack roll or uses the Consume Life bonus action.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes two attacks, using [[/item .hRwqUlEyM9TjOmHy]] or [[/item .mmRadiantFlame00]] in any combination.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLight00000]{Light}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

1/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSpiritGuar]{Spirit Guardians}

Divine Aid.name: Divine Aid
Divine Aid.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLesserRest]{Lesser Restoration}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Dispel Magic.name: Dispel Magic
Dispel Magic.description:
Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any ongoing spell of level 3 or lower on the target ends. For each ongoing spell of level 4 or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability (DC 10 plus that spell's level). On a successful check, the spell ends.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You automatically end a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you use.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and end one condition on it: &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one Large or smaller object that isn't being worn or carried by someone else. Until the spell ends, the object sheds Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like.

Covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description:
You create a floating, spectral force that resembles a weapon of your choice and lasts for the duration. The force appears within range in a space of your choice, and you can immediately make one melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of the force. On a hit, the target takes Force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a Bonus Action on your later turns, you can move the force up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d8 for every slot level above 2.

Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack roll or a damaging spell must succeed on a [[/save ability=wis dc=@attributes.spell.dc format=long]] or either choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn't protect the warded creature from areas of effect. The spell ends if the warded creature makes an attack roll, casts a spell, or deals damage.

materials.value: a shard of glass from a mirror

The spell ends if the warded creature makes an attack roll, casts a spell, or deals damage.

Its game statistics are the same in each form, except for its Speed. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

Queen Forfallen.name: Queen Forfallen
Queen Forfallen.description:
Rust-Riddled Pirate Queen

One of the most influential victims of the supernatural rusting curse throughout the Moonshae Isles is the pirate queen known as Queen Forfallen. She plies the seas in the largest and best-defended ship in the Moonshaes, the prize of her armada, which she’s strengthened with rusty metal plates and filled with a crew of bloodthirsty Rusted berserkers (see this chapter).

Queen Forfallen is a strong human woman with long, red hair. Although the rusting curse has transformed most of her extremities into metal, she’s thus far resisted the weakening corrosion that the curse typically imparts to its victims. Her crew insists that her unquenchable thirst for plunder keep her hale.

History

Few know Queen Forfallen’s background. She prefers to keep her focus on daring deeds as the most renowned pirate queen in the Moonshae Isles. But “Queen Forfallen” is the moniker adopted by Renauta, daughter of Olfgaut, and sister to Norland’s jarl, Olfsvenn. Renauta learned of the Rusting and embraced the curse as a path to strength and prowess.

Queen Forfallen maintains clandestine communications with her brother, and they occasionally feed one another helpful information. Olfsvenn hopes he can steer Forfallen back to her name and role as Renauta, but Forfallen prefers her new identity.

Personality

Queen Forfallen has a personality as powerful as her metal-clad muscles. She has a commanding voice well suited to carrying across a ship-to-ship battle and a firm, blunt demeanor that potential allies find hard to resist. Her growing network of supporters attests to her diplomatic skills and the shrewd mind behind her bold demeanor.

She speaks to the scoundrels, bandits, smugglers, and others who live outside of Norlander society, promising coin and glory. More insidiously, she encourages the Rusting as a path to power, not debilitation, and those who crave her strength seek out infection. Forfallen has done more to spread the curse than anyone else in the Moonshae Isles.

As with all victims of the Rusting, Forfallen feels a strong desire to despoil natural places. She’s been able to keep this desire in check, instead turning her energies to building alliances with other pirates and people afflicted by the Rusting, but she feels no remorse about deforesting old growth for ship’s wood or using ore wrenched from idyllic hills.

Using Queen Forfallen

Queen Forfallen is a powerful warrior and leader. Her crews of Rusted creatures and pirates are well known in the Moonshae Isles, so the characters should hear about Queen Forfallen early in any campaign that features her. They might even see her in the distance at the prow of a ship of bloodthirsty raiders, having just left devastation in her wake.

Queen Forfallen’s secret relation to Olfsvenn, Norland’s jarl, might compel the jarl to take actions that seem to be protecting or sheltering the vicious pirate queen. Uncovering Queen Forfallen’s lineage can provide unexpected opportunities for investigation, politics, and family drama in an otherwise straightforward pirate-hunting campaign.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Forfallen makes three attacks, using [[/item Greataxe]] or [[/item Handaxe]] in any combination.

Greataxe.name: Greataxe
Greataxe.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Rust’s Grip.name: Rust’s Grip
Rust’s Grip.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=AK3aDoUzC7ypU7Dq]], one creature Forfallen can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=AK3aDoUzC7ypU7Dq]] feet. The target has Disadvantage on this save if it has the Poisoned condition.

First Failure: The target has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of its next turn if it’s still Restrained, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Second Failure: The target has the &Reference[Petrified apply=false] condition instead of the Restrained condition, becoming a statue of rusted iron.

Restrained.name: Restrained

Petrified.name: Petrified

Aura of Bravery.name: Aura of Bravery
Aura of Bravery.description: Creatures of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s choice in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=N8uK4xdPCXdknRTb]]-foot Emanation originating from it have Immunity to the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] and &Reference[Frightened apply=false] conditions while there.

Charmed & Frightened.name: Charmed & Frightened
Charmed & Frightened.description: Targets have immunity to the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] and &Reference[Frightened apply=false] conditions while there.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three attacks, using [[/item .ogiSGKeLqpw2g1ek]] or [[/item .xqMyOHm4l8Kqx6K6]] in any combination.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDaylight00]{Daylight}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDispelEvil]{Dispel Evil and Good}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplGreaterRes]{Greater Restoration}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplPhantomSte]{Phantom Steed}

Daylight.name: Daylight
Daylight.description:
For the duration, sunlight spreads from a point within range and fills a 60-foot-radius Sphere. The sunlight’s area is Bright Light and sheds Dim Light for an additional 60 feet.

Alternatively, you cast the spell on an object that isn’t being worn or carried, causing the sunlight to fill a 60-foot Emanation originating from that object. Covering that object with something opaque, such as a bowl or helm, blocks the sunlight.

If any of this spell’s area overlaps with an area of Darkness created by a spell of level 3 or lower, that other spell is dispelled.

Dispel Evil and Good.name: Dispel Evil and Good
Dispel Evil and Good.description:
For the duration, Celestials, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, and Undead have Disadvantage on attack rolls against you. You can end the spell early by using either of the following special functions.

Break Enchantment. As a Magic action, you touch a creature that is possessed by or has the &Reference[Charmed] or &Reference[Frightened] condition from one or more creatures of the types above. The target is no longer possessed, Charmed, or Frightened by such creatures.

Dismissal. As a Magic action, you target one creature you can see within 5 feet of you that has one of the creature types above. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be sent back to its home plane if it isn’t there already. If they aren’t on their home plane, Undead are sent to the Shadowfell, and Fey are sent to the Feywild.

affects.special: Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead
Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead

Dispelling Evil and Good.name: Dispelling Evil and Good
Dispelling Evil and Good.description: For the duration, Celestials, Elementals, Fey, Fiends, and Undead have Disadvantage on attack rolls against you. You can end the spell early by using either of the following special functions: Break Enchantment or Dismissal.

Greater Restoration.name: Greater Restoration
Greater Restoration.description:
你触碰一名生物并魔法性地移除目标身上的下列效应之一：

  • 1 级 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false]{力竭}
  • &Reference[Charmed apply=false]{魅惑}或&Reference[Petrified apply=false]{石化}状态
  • 一道诅咒，包括目标因与一件被诅咒魔法物品的同调所陷入的诅咒。
  • 目标某项属性值的减损
  • 目标生命值上限的降低

materials.value: diamond dust worth 100+ GP, which the spell consumes

Phantom Steed.name: Phantom Steed
Phantom Steed.description:
A Large, quasi-real, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.actors.Actor.phbsumPhantomSte]{horselike creature} appears on the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice within range. You decide the creature’s appearance, and it is equipped with a saddle, bit, and bridle. Any of the equipment created by the spell vanishes in a puff of smoke if it is carried more than 10 feet away from the steed.

For the duration, you or a creature you choose can ride the steed. The steed uses the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.actors.Actor.phbmobRidingHors]{Riding Horse} stat block (see appendix B), except it has a Speed of 100 feet and can travel 13 miles in an hour. When the spell ends, the steed gradually fades, giving the rider 1 minute to dismount. The spell ends early if the steed takes any damage.

Agile.name: Agile
Agile.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] doesn’t provoke an &Reference[opportunityattacks]{Opportunity Attack} when it moves out of an enemy’s reach.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes three [[/item Injecting Claw]] attacks.

Injecting Claw.name: Injecting Claw
Injecting Claw.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Humanoid not cursed by a [[lookup @name lowercase]], it is subjected to the following effect.

Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=C5wp4BSKfYlbMurm]].

Failure: The target is cursed unawares, and a minuscule slaad egg is implanted in it. Removing the curse destroys the egg.

Over [[/r 2d4*10#Days egg gestates]]{2d4 × 10} days, the egg gestates. In the final 24 hours, the cursed target feels unwell; its Speed is halved, and it has Disadvantage on D20 Tests. At the end of this time, the egg turns into a @UUID[Compendium.dnd-monster-manual.actors.Actor.mmSlaadTadpole00]{Slaad Tadpole}, which chews out of the host and kills it.

Pack Tactics.name: Pack Tactics
Pack Tactics.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

Heat Aura.name: Heat Aura
Heat Aura.description: At the end of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turns, each [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=LDcQJj3oXyPCuCaT]] in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=LDcQJj3oXyPCuCaT]]-foot Emanation originating from the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes [[/damage average]] damage.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=xWlMeXFjELfSUWX9]] creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[lookup @skills.ath.passive]]), and it has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Grappled & Restrained.name: Grappled & Restrained
Grappled & Restrained.description: If the target is a [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=xWlMeXFjELfSUWX9]] creature, it has the &Reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC [[/check ability=str skill=ath format=long]], see source item for DC), and it has the &Reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Swallow.name: Swallow
Swallow.description:
Strength Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=YorssyWMumAsvzx3]], [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=YorssyWMumAsvzx3]] by the [[lookup @name lowercase]] (it can have up to two creatures swallowed at a time).

Failure: The target is swallowed by the [[lookup @name lowercase]], and the Grappled condition ends. A swallowed creature has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Restrained apply=false] conditions, it has &Reference[Total Cover] against attacks and other effects outside the [[lookup @name lowercase]], and it takes [[/damage average activity=zrWNjO9mkbN28spL]] damage at the start of each of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s turns.

If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] must succeed on a [[/save format=long activity=rGeGukkm2t2fXsoy]] at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, each of which falls in a space within [[lookup @range.value activity=rGeGukkm2t2fXsoy]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition. If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, any swallowed creature no longer has the Restrained condition and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting Prone.

affects.special: one Large or smaller creature Grappled

Blinded, Restrained, and Total Cover.name: Blinded, Restrained, and Total Cover
Blinded, Restrained, and Total Cover.description: While swallowed, a creature has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] and &Reference[Restrained apply=false] conditions, has &Reference[Total Cover apply=false] against attacks.

Prone.name: Prone
Prone.description: If you are regurgitated, you fall into a space within 10 ft. and are &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Undead Restoration.name: Undead Restoration
Undead Restoration.description: If the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies, it revives 24 hours later in a different body unless @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplDispelEvil]{Dispel Evil and Good} is cast on its corpse. If it revives, it animates a Humanoid corpse elsewhere on the same plane of existence; it now looks different but uses the same stat block and returns with all its Hit Points.

After [[lookup @duration.value activity=r2U9soI3vKTrXhG1]] [[lookup @duration.units activity=r2U9soI3vKTrXhG1]], it succeeds automatically. If the Frightened target is cursed by the [[lookup @name lowercase]] (see [[/item .LuIttybjU4f7tGCs]]), the target also has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration.

Frightened.description: The target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

The curse ends on the target if the [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses this Bonus Action on a different creature.

The tentacle can be damaged, freeing a creature it has Grappled when destroyed (AC 20, HP 10, Immunity to Poison and Psychic damage). Damaging the tentacle deals no damage to the [[lookup @name lowercase]], and a destroyed tentacle regrows at the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] targets one [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=dcSC7EuknnM0uoqY]] object—armor or a weapon—worn or carried by a creature within [[lookup @range.value activity=dcSC7EuknnM0uoqY]] feet of itself.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=dcSC7EuknnM0uoqY]], the creature with the object.

Failure: The object takes a -1 penalty to the AC it offers (armor) or to its attack rolls (weapon). Armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10, and a weapon is destroyed if its penalty reaches -5. The penalty can be removed by casting the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMending000] spell on the armor or weapon.

Foundry Note

This feature also provides a Damaged Enchantment effect that will modify the targeted object. Due to the fact that the equipment penalty can be applied multiple times, the enchantment needs to be dragged from this item's Effects tab onto the target Item's sheet.

Damaged: -1 AC/Attack.name: Damaged: -1 AC/Attack
Damaged: -1 AC/Attack.description: The object takes a -1 penalty to the AC it offers (armor) or to its attack rolls (weapon). Armor is destroyed if the penalty reduces its AC to 10, and a weapon is destroyed if its penalty reaches -5. The penalty can be removed by casting the @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplMending000] spell on the armor or weapon.

Rusted Behemoth.name: Rusted Behemoth
Rusted Behemoth.description:
Construct Victims of a Supernatural Curse

The supernatural Rusting curse that pervades the Moonshae Isles manifests as a thin scrim of iron over a living creature’s skin. This coarse iron rusts easily, turning the creature a sickly orange gray. Unchecked, this curse transforms the victim into a Rusted, an animated iron caricature of itself that sheds flakes of toxic rust.

As the Rusting curse hardens the skin, it also hollows out the mind. Rusted creatures despise unspoiled nature and are compelled to destroy it when they can.

Other Rusted

You can turn any Beast, Fey, Giant, Humanoid, or Monstrosity into a Rusted version of itself by doing the following: change the creature’s type to Construct, and give it Immunity to Poison damage and the Exhaustion, Petrified, and Poisoned conditions.

Rusted Behemoth

A giant overtaken by the Rusting is a fearsome juggernaut, rending trees and hills in a mindless rage. Their tough, rusted skin turns away blades and arrows in a shower of toxic orange dust. Rusted behemoths enjoy despoiling the wilderness.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The Rusted makes three attacks, using [[/item Slam]] or [[/item Rusted Shot Put]] in any combination.

Rusted Shot Put.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]], and the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Poisoned.description: The target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Rust-Riddled Hide.name: Rust-Riddled Hide
Rust-Riddled Hide.description:
Trigger: The Rusted is hit by an attack roll that deals Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage.

Response—Constitution Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=nAcnATJAvFGur0w4]], each creature of the Rusted’s choice in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=nAcnATJAvFGur0w4]]-foot Emanation originating from the Rusted.

Failure: the target has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of the target’s next turn.

Rusted Berserker.name: Rusted Berserker
Rusted Berserker.description:
Construct Victims of a Supernatural Curse

The supernatural Rusting curse that pervades the Moonshae Isles manifests as a thin scrim of iron over a living creature’s skin. This coarse iron rusts easily, turning the creature a sickly orange gray. Unchecked, this curse transforms the victim into a Rusted, an animated iron caricature of itself that sheds flakes of toxic rust.

As the Rusting curse hardens the skin, it also hollows out the mind. Rusted creatures despise unspoiled nature and are compelled to destroy it when they can.

Other Rusted

You can turn any Beast, Fey, Giant, Humanoid, or Monstrosity into a Rusted version of itself by doing the following: change the creature’s type to Construct, and give it Immunity to Poison damage and the Exhaustion, Petrified, and Poisoned conditions.

Rusted Berserker

A Rusted berserker is a human Norlander transformed by the Rusting. These berserkers have forsaken the traditional Norlander lifestyle to rage against nature and its protectors.

Rusted Wyrm.name: Rusted Wyrm
Rusted Wyrm.description:
Construct Victims of a Supernatural Curse

The supernatural Rusting curse that pervades the Moonshae Isles manifests as a thin scrim of iron over a living creature’s skin. This coarse iron rusts easily, turning the creature a sickly orange gray. Unchecked, this curse transforms the victim into a Rusted, an animated iron caricature of itself that sheds flakes of toxic rust.

As the Rusting curse hardens the skin, it also hollows out the mind. Rusted creatures despise unspoiled nature and are compelled to destroy it when they can.

Other Rusted

You can turn any Beast, Fey, Giant, Humanoid, or Monstrosity into a Rusted version of itself by doing the following: change the creature’s type to Construct, and give it Immunity to Poison damage and the Exhaustion, Petrified, and Poisoned conditions.

Rusted Wyrm

A Rusted wyrm is a draconic colossus capable of phenomenal devastation. Although some Rusted wyrms evaporate rivers and destroy springs, others venture further underwater to wreck coral reefs and boil the sea.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target starts burning.

Success: Half damage only.

Failure or Success: Being underwater doesn’t grant Resistance to this Fire damage.

Encasing Rust.name: Encasing Rust
Encasing Rust.description:

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC [[lookup @attributes.spell.dc]]):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplThaumaturg]{Thaumaturgy}

2/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHoldPerson]{Hold Person}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplTongues000]{Tongues}

Fiendish Aid.name: Fiendish Aid
Fiendish Aid.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplBless00000]{Bless} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd-players-handbook.spells.Item.phbsplHealingWor]{Healing Word}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

Bless.name: Bless
Bless.description:
You bless up to three creatures within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 1.

Blessed.name: Blessed
Blessed.description: Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target adds 1d4 to the attack roll or save.

Healing Word.name: Healing Word
Healing Word.description:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains Hit Points equal to 2d4 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The healing increases by 2d4 for each spell slot level above 1.

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You manifest a minor wonder within range. You create one of the effects below within range. If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time.

Altered Eyes. You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

Booming Voice. Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute. For the duration, you have Advantage on [[/check ability=cha skill=itm]] checks.

Fire Play. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

Invisible Hand. You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

Phantom Sound. You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

Tremors. You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

Hold Person.name: Hold Person
Hold Person.description:
Choose a Humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or have the &Reference[paralyzed apply=false] condition for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional Humanoid for each spell slot level above 2.

Paralyzed.name: Paralyzed
Paralyzed.description: At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the [[/save ability=wis]] save, ending the spell on itself on a success.

Tongues.name: Tongues
Tongues.description: This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand any spoken or signed language that it hears or sees. Moreover, when the target communicates by speaking or signing, any creature that knows at least one language can understand it if that creature can hear the speech or see the signing.

The target gains 1 &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level whenever it takes this burning damage.

Foundry Note

This feature provides an Active Effect that will modify the targeted object. Due to the fact that effect can be applied multiple times, the effect needs to be dragged from this item's Effect tab onto the target item's sheet each time the target gains a level of exhaustion after the initial level is applied.

Charming. The target has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for [[lookup @duration.value activity=mOFKBLSi65tp5u3i]] [[lookup @duration.units activity=mOFKBLSi65tp5u3i]]. While Charmed, the target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and uses all its movement to dance in place. The effect ends on the target if it takes any damage.

Frightening. [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition for [[lookup @duration.value activity=ib78HezKRQ8jxfKz]] [[lookup @duration.units activity=ib78HezKRQ8jxfKz]]. If the target ends its turn out of line of sight from the [[lookup @name lowercase]], the condition ends on it.

While Charmed, the target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and uses all its movement to dance in place.
